info.description: Run and develop self-hosted AI apps. Your programmable in-house GPT. The Firebase for the AI age.
info.title: Singulatron

delete.description: Delete a specific message from a chat thread by its ID

post.description:
Create a new chat thread and add the requesting user to it.
Requires the `chat-svc:thread:create` permission.

get.description: Fetch information about a specific chat thread by its ID

put.description: Modify the details of a specific chat thread

delete.description: Delete a specific chat thread by its ID

post.description: Add a new message to a specific thread.
Fetch messages (and associated assets) for a specific chat thread.
Fetch all chat threads associated with a specific user

get.description: Fetch the current configuration from the server

post.description: Save the provided configuration to the server

put.description:
Launches a Docker container with the specified parameters.

Requires the `docker-svc:docker:create` permission.

get.description: Check if a Docker container identified by the hash is running
get.summary: Check If a Container Is Running

get.description: Get a summary of the Docker container identified by the hash, limited to a specified number of lines
Retrieve information about the Docker host
Retrieve detailed information about the Docker service

put.description:
Start a download for a specified URL.

Requires the `download-svc:download:create` permission.

get.description:
Get a download by ID.

Requires the `download-svc:download:view` permission.

put.description:
Pause a download that is currently in progress.

Requires the `download-svc:download:edit` permission.

post.description:
Fetch a list of all download details.

Requires the `download-svc:download:view` permission.
Publishes an event to the firehose service after authorization check

get.description: Establish a subscription to the firehose events and accept a real time stream of them.

post.description: Creates a new object with the provided details. Requires authorization and user authentication.

put.description: Creates a new generic object or updates an existing one based on the provided data. Requires authorization and user authentication.

200.description: Successful creation or update of object

post.description:
Retrieves objects from a specified table based on search criteria.
Requires authorization and user authentication.


Use helper functions in your respective client library such as condition constructors (`equal`, `contains`, `startsWith`) and field selectors (`field`, `fields`, `id`) for easier access.
Removes a generic object from the system based on the provided conditions. Requires authorization and user authentication.
Updates objects in a specified table based on provided conditions. Requires authorization and user authentication.

put.description:
Starts The Default Model.

Requires the `model-svc:model:create` permission.

get.description:
Retrieves the status of the default model.

Requires the `model-svc:model:view` permission.

Retrieves the details of a model by its ID.

the Requires `model.view` permission.

put.description: Sets a model as the default model  when prompts are sent without a Model ID, the default model is used.

get.description:
Retrieves the status of a model by ID.

Requires the `model-svc:model:view` permission.

post.description:
Retrieves a list of models.

Requires `model-svc:model:view` permission.
Retrieve a list of nodes.
Adds a new prompt to the prompt queue and either waits for the response (if `sync` is set to true), or returns immediately.
List prompts that satisfy a query.
Remove a prompt by ID.

get.description: Subscribe to prompt responses via Server-Sent Events (SSE)

post.description: Allows an authenticated user to change their own password.
Allows an administrator to change a user's password.
Authenticates a user and returns a token.

put.description: Creates or updates a permission. The permission ID must be prefixed by the callers username (email). Eg. if the owner's email/username is `petstore-svc` the permission should look like `petstore-svc:pet:edit`. Requires the `user-svc:permission:create` permission.

400.description: Bad Request: Invalid JSON or Bad Namespace

post.description: Check if a user is authorized for a specific permission.

400.description: Invalid JSON or missing permission id

get.description: Get the public key to descrypt the JWT.

400.description: Invalid JSON or missing permission id

post.description: Register a new user with a name, email, and password.

Create a new role. The role ID must be prefixed by the callers username (email). Eg. if the owner's email/username is `petstore-svc` the role should look like `petstore-svc:admin`. The user account who creates the role will become the owner of that role, and only the owner will be able to edit the role. Requires the `user-svc:role:create` permission.

delete.description: Delete a role based on the role ID.

put.description:
Adds a specific permission to a role identified by roleId.

Requires the `user-svc:permission:assign` permission.

get.description: Retrieve permissions associated with a specific role ID.

put.description:
Set permissions for a specified role. The caller can add permissions it owns to any role.
If the caller tries to add a permission it doesn't own to a role, `StatusBadRequest` will be returned.

get.description: Retrieve all roles from the user service.

post.description: Allows an authenticated administrator to create a new user with specified details.
Retrieve user information based on an authentication token.

put.description: Save user profile information based on the provided user ID.

delete.description: Delete a user based on the user ID.

post.description: Fetches a list of users with optional query filters and pagination.

content.description: Content is the base64 encoded binary file direcly embedded in the asset itself

assetIds.description: AssetIds defines the attachments the message has.

content.description: Content of the message eg. "Hi, what's up?"

userId.description:
UserId is the id of the user who wrote the message.
For AI messages this field is empty.

topicIds.description:
TopicIds defines which topics the thread belongs to.
Topics can roughly be thought of as tags for threads.

userIds.description: UserIds the ids of the users who can see this thread.

isRuntimeInstalled.description:
* This flag drives a minor UX feature:
	 * if the user has not installed the runtime we show an INSTALL
	 * button, but if the user has already installed the runtime we show
	 * we show a START runtime button.
	 *

contains.description: Contains condition returns all objects where the field(s) values contain a particular string.

equal.description: Equal condition returns objects where value of a field equals (=) to the specified value in the query.

startsWith.description: StartsWith condition returns all objects where the field(s) values start with a particular string.

selector.description: Selector selects one, more or all fields
Selector selects one, more or all fields

any.description: Any matches any fields in the object

oneOf.description: OneOf matches a number of fields

desc.description: Desc indicates whether the sorting should be in descending order.

field.description: The field by which to order the results

randomize.description: Randomize indicates that the results should be randomized instead of ordered by the `field` and `desc` criteria

after.description:
After is used for paginations. Instead of offset-based pagination,
we support cursor-based pagination because it works better in a scalable,
distributed environment.

conditions.description:
Conditions are filtering options of a query. It is advised to use
It's advised to use helper functions in your respective client library such as condition constructors (`all`, `equal`, `contains`, `startsWith`) and field selectors (`field`, `fields`, `id`) for easier access.

count.description:
Count true means return the count of the dataset filtered by Conditions
without after or limit.

limit.description: Limit the number of records in the result set.

selector.description: Selector selects one, more or all fields

public.description:
Public determines if the object is visible to all users.
When it's false the entry is only visible to the user who created it.
When it's true the entry is visible to everyone.

Public determines if the object is visible to all users.
When it's false the entry is only visible to the user who created it.
When it's true the entry is visible to everyone.

envars.description:
Envars passed to the container. eg.
	'DEVICES=all'

persistentPaths.description: Paths in the container to persist.

port.description: Port is the internal port of the Container

running.description:
Running triggers onModelLaunch on the frontend.
	Running is true when the model is both running and answering
	- fully loaded.

id.description: Id is the unique ID of the prompt.

maxRetries.description: MaxRetries specified how many times the system should retry a prompt when it keeps erroring.

modelId.description: ModelId is just the Singulatron internal ID of the model.

prompt.description: Prompt is the message itself eg. "What's a banana?

sync.description:
Sync drives whether prompt add request should wait and hang until
the prompt is done executing. By default the prompt just gets put on a queue
and the client will just subscribe to a Thread Stream.
For quick and dirty scripting however it's often times easier to do things syncronously.
In those cases set Sync to true.

template.description: Template of the prompt. Optional. If not present it's derived from ModelId.

threadId.description:
ThreadId is the ID of the thread a prompt belongs to.
Clients subscribe to Thread Streams to see the answer to a prompt,
or set `prompt.sync` to true for a blocking answer.

createdAt.description: CreatedAt is the time of the prompt creation.

error.description: Error that arose during prompt execution, if any.

id.description: Id is the unique ID of the prompt.

lastRun.description: LastRun is the time of the last prompt run.

maxRetries.description: MaxRetries specified how many times the system should retry a prompt when it keeps erroring.

modelId.description: ModelId is just the Singulatron internal ID of the model.

prompt.description: Prompt is the message itself eg. "What's a banana?

runCount.description: RunCount is the number of times the prompt was retried due to errors

sync.description:
Sync drives whether prompt add request should wait and hang until
the prompt is done executing. By default the prompt just gets put on a queue
and the client will just subscribe to a Thread Stream.
For quick and dirty scripting however it's often times easier to do things syncronously.
In those cases set Sync to true.

template.description: Template of the prompt. Optional. If not present it's derived from ModelId.

threadId.description:
ThreadId is the ID of the thread a prompt belongs to.
Clients subscribe to Thread Streams to see the answer to a prompt,
or set `prompt.sync` to true for a blocking answer.

updatedAt.description: UpdatedAt is the last time the prompt was updated.

userId.description: UserId contains the ID of the user who submitted the prompt.

roleIds.description: Many to many relationship between User and Role

BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and token acquired from the User sService Login endpoint.
BearerAuth.name: Authorization
